prompts: I’m launching a TikTok dance challenge to the chorus loop of “Levitating” by Dua Lipa (~15 seconds). Pitch 3 distinct challenge concepts. For each, include: a catchy challenge name, a simple 4-count move sequence (write it on one line, e.g., Step R, Step L, Body roll, Clap), one rule twist (e.g., spin, level change, hand transition), and one filming tip. Keep each concept to 2–3 sentences max.

Create two beginner-friendly duet dance challenge ideas for Instagram Reels that use a single chair as a prop (max 20 seconds per video). For each idea, outline: Leader vs. Follower roles, a call-and-response 8-count pattern, a short safety note (no jumps off the chair), and one unique hashtag. Keep it concise and practical.

I'm filming a 60-second TikTok lip-sync to Taylor Swift's "Anti-Hero." Solo performer, one phone camera, living room set. Available props: mirror, floor lamp, coffee mug, bathrobe, sticky notes, doorway. I want punchy, comedic storytelling with a relatable twist. Please suggest 3 skit concepts with a beat-by-beat outline (4–5 beats each), including quick prop gags and one visual punchline per concept. Keep it concise.

We're five teens doing a 3-minute lip-sync mashup for a school talent show (family-friendly). Songs in order: Uptown Funk (00:00–00:45), Shake It Off (00:45–01:30), Can't Stop the Feeling! (01:30–03:00). Props on hand: 5 hats, sunglasses, a rolling chair, 2 brooms, and 3 cardboard signs; stage has one handheld mic and a movable spotlight. Please give 3 different skit concepts with simple blocking and clear transition moments between songs, plus one crowd-interaction beat. Keep each idea to 5–6 short bullet points.

I’m filming a 15-second fashion Reel with 3 outfit changes and want three different transitions: a doorframe mask reveal, a right-to-left whip pan, and a snap-to-jump cut synced to a beat. Please give me a concise plan that includes: a 6–8 shot list, how to shoot each transition practically (camera moves, framing, lighting continuity), and quick edit steps in CapCut or Premiere (direction match, motion blur, speed ramp in/out points, and where to place the cut on the music beat). Keep the instructions tight and actionable.

Help me connect these raw clips into a 7–9 second creative transition sequence for Instagram: (1) 0:02 close-up of me zipping a jacket, (2) 0:01 left-to-right whip pan of the city skyline, (3) 0:03 handheld shot tilting from sand up to the ocean, (4) 0:01.5 of me jumping with arms up. Suggest a cohesive chain of transitions between each pair (e.g., match-on-action, whip match, object wipe), what to match in frame (color/shape/motion), approximate cut timings (e.g., on-beat at 0:01.0, 0:03.2), and one whoosh/beat-drop SFX cue to glue it together.

Help me mash up two popular TikTok formats: lo-fi “core memory” montages and rapid-fire “hot take” stitches. Apply it to a city museum’s summer program (free Fridays, maker workshops, rooftop jazz). Give 5 short video concept ideas; for each, include a 1-sentence description and an opening hook line under 12 words.

Remix two 2025 food/lifestyle trends—“little treat culture” and the “mocktail renaissance”—into a limited cafe menu. Propose 6 items: 3 small desserts and 3 zero-proof drinks. For each, give a playful name and a one-sentence Instagram caption.

Please write as a duet between 'Chef' and 'Nutritionist' using these ingredients: tomatoes, canned chickpeas, spinach, feta, olive oil, lemon, garlic, cumin. Step 1: Chef proposes a quick weeknight recipe in 2–3 sentences. Step 2: Nutritionist comments in 2–3 sentences on nutritional pros/cons and suggested tweaks. Step 3: Stitch both perspectives into one concise dinner game plan in 3–4 sentences.

Duet and stitch on the topic: Roman aqueducts. First, in 2–3 sentences each, have a 'Historian' and an 'Engineer' explain how they worked and why they mattered. Then stitch their views into a single, plain-language summary (4–5 sentences) for a curious middle-schooler.

I'm brainstorming short stories that use a collective 'we' POV in a storm-battered coastal village grappling with sea-level rise. Please propose 5 distinct premises, each 2–3 sentences, that show how the plural voice shapes the stakes and identify the exact moment the chorus fractures into a single 'I.'

Give me 6 one-sentence hook ideas for a second-person psychological horror story set in a high-rise at 2 a.m., where the reader is the protagonist and the terror comes from small, escalating losses of agency.
Write a 15-second stand-up bit about realizing your phone is “lost” while it’s literally in your hand. Keep it clean, about 40–60 words, with a clear setup, a punchline, and one quick tag.
I need a 15-second comedy bit for a Reels voiceover: POV you’re a smart fridge judging my midnight snack choices. Keep it PG, playful, 40–60 words, and end on a snappy punchline.

Create a 60-second day-in-the-life mini vlog script for me, a first-year nurse on a 12-hour shift at a city hospital. Schedule: 5:30am wake/coffee; 6:15 bus commute; 7:00 shift huddle; 9:30 med pass; 12:15 lunch with a coworker; 2:00 code-blue drill; 4:45 charting crunch; 7:15 handoff; 8:00 decompress with tea and journaling. Please include: a punchy hook, a quick scene list with rough timestamps, on-screen text ideas for each scene, and a simple closing CTA. Keep it tight and high-energy.

Help me storyboard a 45-second day-in-the-life mini vlog as a freelance illustrator working from a tiny studio apartment. I want 7 shots max: morning sketch warm-up, checking client feedback, iPad time-lapse drawing, coffee break with my cat, packaging prints, sunset neighborhood walk, and uploading final files. Give me a short voiceover (1–2 lines per shot), suggested b-roll for each, and one music vibe reference. Make it casual and cozy.

I just got home and need a fast dinner. I’ve got: 4 large flour tortillas, 1 can black beans (rinsed), 1 cup shredded cheddar, half an onion, a jar of salsa, a lime, a handful of cilantro, and a splash of cooking oil. No oven, just a stovetop and a single skillet. Can you give me a simple 10-minute quesadilla hack (minimal chopping) with exact steps, approximate heat levels, and one optional twist if I have leftover rotisserie chicken?

Craving something sweet—what’s a single-serving microwave mug cake hack I can make in under 3 minutes using: 1 ripe banana, 2 tablespoons peanut butter, 2 tablespoons cocoa powder, a pinch of baking powder, a splash of milk (dairy or oat), and a few chocolate chips? Please include measurements, the microwave time for a 1000W microwave, and one quick topping idea using only pantry items.

Give me a 5-step makeup tutorial for a fast, polished office look that works under glasses for combination skin. I have: tinted moisturizer, concealer, brow gel, a neutral eyeshadow quad, brown eyeliner, mascara, peach blush, and a sheer nude lipstick. Please keep it to exactly five clearly labeled steps with brief application tips.

Can you outline a 5-step evening glam routine for a deep skin tone with hooded eyes that lasts 6+ hours? Tools I have: primer, full-coverage foundation, setting powder, warm matte eyeshadows, gold shimmer, black liquid liner, contour stick, highlighter, berry matte lipstick, and setting spray. Keep it concise—exactly five steps with succinct placement instructions.

I’m posting an OOTD with a '90s minimalist' theme for a casual Friday in a smart-casual office. Weather: 60°F/16°C with light rain. I prefer neutral colors, straight-leg jeans, and loafers; I'm 5'4" and petite. Can you suggest a full outfit (top, outerwear, shoes, accessories), one quick styling tip, and a short caption?

Help me plan today’s gym-to-brunch OOTD with an 'athleisure with a pop of color' theme. Budget-friendly pieces only. It’s sunny and 78°F (26°C). I own black leggings, white sneakers, a cobalt blue windbreaker, gold hoops, and a canvas tote. Suggest how to style these, what top to add, and a 1–2 sentence caption with a couple of hashtags.

I found an oversized men's wool blazer at the thrift (size 46R, fully lined, shoulder pads, two-button). I want to flip it into a cropped, boxy women's jacket with a raw hem and slightly shortened sleeves, no sewing machine—just hand-stitching and fabric glue if needed. Can you give me a compact materials list and a step-by-step (max 8 steps) on how to do this cleanly, including how to deal with the lining and keep the front pockets functional?

I scored a beat-up solid oak dresser with chipped veneer on two drawer fronts and water rings on the top. I'd like to flip it to a modern Japandi look: light wood, new pulls, and a thin slatted overlay to hide the damaged veneer. Please propose a simple plan with: (1) surface prep approach, (2) how to apply a lightweight slat overlay just to the two damaged drawers, and (3) a light, durable finish. Keep the response to 10–12 bullet points.

I’ve got 12 minutes, a yoga mat, and two 10 lb dumbbells. I’m a beginner. Can you give me a quick full‑body circuit (4–5 moves, 2 rounds) with rep ranges, 30–45 sec rest guidance, and one short form cue per exercise?
I need an apartment‑friendly, no‑equipment, quiet 8‑minute core finisher to do after a run. Please list 5 moves (30–45 sec each), a brief form cue, and one simple modification for each.

Help me design a clean 'study with me' livestream setup for YouTube. Gear: Windows 11 laptop (RTX 3050), OBS 30.1, Logitech C920 webcam, Blue Yeti Nano mic, a 12-inch dimmable ring light, and a quiet mechanical keyboard. Desk is 120×60 cm against a white wall; window is on my left. I want 50/10 Pomodoro with an on-screen minimalist timer and a small 'goals for the session' box; stream at 1080p 30 fps. Please give me: (1) camera and light placement, (2) basic OBS scene layout and recommended settings (bitrate, output, filters), and (3) mic gain/noise-reduction tips to reduce key clacks. Keep it to actionable steps I can try in 10 minutes.

Can you structure a 3-hour 'study-with-me' block I can follow solo this afternoon? I'm revising for a history midterm on Cold War diplomacy. I get distracted easily and tend to skip breaks. I'd like: a schedule using 40/10 intervals, a one-sentence focus mantra for each interval, tiny on-camera check-in prompts I can say out loud at the start of each block, and two simple break activities that don't involve my phone. Also suggest a neutral background sound (rain or cafe?) and a short closing ritual to wrap up.

I'm a remote product manager drowning in Slack pings and back-to-back Zooms. In 5 bullets, each 1 sentence, share quick productivity moves I can try this week to protect deep work without missing critical messages. Keep under 100 words.

Design me a 25-minute 'exam cram' micro-routine for a college student with 3 finals next week, using only a notebook, timer, and phone on Do Not Disturb. Give numbered steps (max 6), each actionable and terse, plus one optional 2-minute reset. 90 words max.

Help me script a 20–25 second BookTok rec video for cozy fantasy (found family, low stakes, queer-friendly). Give me 3 book picks (published in the last 10 years), each with: title + author, a 10–12 word hook, and one vivid emoji. Then write: 1) a punchy opening hook line for VO, 2) a line-by-line voiceover script that names all three books and keeps total VO under 85 words, 3) on-screen text for each shot (max 6 words each), 4) a short caption (under 120 characters) and 5) five relevant hashtags. Keep it snappy and trending.

Make me a chaotic, high-energy BookTok rec for dark academia with unhinged female leads. I need: 4 recs (mix of backlist and recent), each with a 7–9 word micro-pitch and a 1–10 'grim vibes' rating. Then write a 15-second script with a cold open hook, quick staccato lines for each title, and a playful CTA. Add a single-line caption and 6 hashtags. Avoid spoilers.

My rescue dog barks and trembles whenever a motorcycle passes by our apartment, but he’s otherwise calm. What could be triggering this reaction, and what quick steps can I take in the moment to help him settle? Please keep the advice to 4–5 sentences.
Write 5 playful Instagram captions for this clip: my tabby cat hears the can opener, freezes with huge eyes, then sprints into frame meowing like a tiny siren. Keep each caption under 12 words.

I'm planning a 20-minute no-talking ASMR video using only objects found in a kitchen (no mouth sounds, no tapping on ceramics). I have a Blue Yeti in stereo. Could you suggest 8 distinct trigger ideas, each with a 1–2 sentence description of how to perform them and how long to spend on each?

I get tingles from slow fabric sounds and soft scratching but hate crinkles. For bedtime, can you propose a simple 12-minute ASMR routine I can do without talking, using a sweater, a makeup brush, and a notebook? Please outline the sequence and the specific motions to try.

I'm shooting three 8–10 second, loopable 'satisfying cleaning' clips in my kitchen. Available props: spray bottle, microfiber cloth, dish soap, sponge, baking soda, and a squeegee. Please give me a concise shot plan for each clip (3–4 beats) that will loop seamlessly, specifying the opening/closing frame for the loop, plus one short on-screen caption per clip.

I want a minimal, repeatable 'cleaning loop' to keep my 420 sq ft studio tidy in under 20 minutes a day. Context: I cook nightly, have a small bathroom, one desk, and no pets. Propose 4–5 micro-tasks that cycle in a loop with a simple timer pattern (e.g., 4 minutes each), suggest a daily rotation so it stays fresh, and include a one-line printable checklist I can stick on the fridge.

I’m renting a 500 sq ft one-bedroom (can’t drill), with tiny closets, about 300 books, a stack of board games, and a cat (litter box, food, carriers, toys). I want it to feel airy, with zones for entry, living, and WFH. What renter-friendly storage and layout tips would you suggest to hide pet stuff and store books/games on a small budget? Please give concise, actionable bullet points.

Can you give me a 60-minute declutter-and-organize plan for my small kitchen? Inventory: 8 pots/pans, 2 cutting boards, air fryer, blender, rice cooker, 30 spices, 3 baking sheets, 4 mixing bowls, ~20 mismatched food containers, utensils with no organizer. Space: 2 drawers, 3 lower cabinets, 1 tall pantry cabinet (half full), limited counter space. Goals: clear counters, easy meal prep, daily-use items accessible. Include low-cost organizer ideas and where each category should go.

I filmed a 45-second timelapse of crocheting a sunflower coaster from a magic ring to the final blocking. Please write an upbeat voiceover script (100–130 words) aligned to timestamps at 0:00, 0:10, 0:25, 0:35, and 0:43, with quick cues like “round 1,” “petals,” and “join & weave ends.” End with a friendly call to like and subscribe.

I’m planning a DIY timelapse of building a simple pine floating shelf (24x6 inches) using pocket holes and a hidden bracket. Can you outline 6–8 key shots to capture in order, 3 lighting/composition tips for a bright daylight look, and a minimal gear checklist? Keep bullets concise (max one sentence each).

I'm posting a 45-second timelapse of me oil painting a moody seascape on an 8x10 canvas using a limited palette (ultramarine, burnt umber, titanium white). Setup: iPhone top-down on a gooseneck, mixed daylight + warm desk lamp. Key steps: thin umber underpainting, wet-into-wet sky, scraping waves with a palette knife, soft glazing, and a quick signature at the end. Can you provide: (1) a simple 6-beat storyboard (hook, process beats, reveal), (2) on-screen captions for each beat (max 8 words), (3) a single one-sentence voiceover, (4) 5 royalty-free music vibe ideas (genres/moods only), and (5) 10 relevant Instagram Reels hashtags? Keep it tight and punchy.

I have a 60-second Procreate timelapse of drawing a neon-lit cyberpunk alley at night. It shows perspective grid setup, lasso-fill block-in, brush swaps, Color Dodge neon glow, and a quick motion-blur rain pass—but the auto timelapse feels chaotic. For YouTube Shorts, please outline: (1) a punchy structure with rough timecodes from 0:00–1:00 for VO beats, (2) 5 short on-screen text overlays (under 30 characters), (3) where to add speed ramps or freeze-frames to highlight key techniques, and (4) a title and thumbnail text (each under 40 characters). Keep suggestions concise.

Headed to Porto for 48 hours in late March (solo, budget traveler). Could you write a quick mini guide: the best area to stay for affordability and walkability, 3 must-see sights plus one hidden gem, 2 food/drink things to try (with specific places), how to get around (transit vs walking), and one weather/packing tip for March? Keep it snappy.

I’ve got a 7-hour layover at Tokyo Haneda (HND) on a Tuesday, arriving 9:30 AM, US passport, carry-on only. Please give me a concise mini-guide for a low-stress side trip: is it worth clearing immigration, a suggested itinerary with rough times, simple transport directions to a nearby neighborhood, one lunch recommendation, and a backup plan if queues are long.

I want to cut our weekly grocery spend from about $120 to $85 without eating junk. We’re a family of 3 (two adults + one 9-year-old). Typical week: breakfasts = cereal, eggs, toast; lunches = sandwiches or leftovers; dinners = spaghetti with meat sauce, chicken stir-fry, tacos, frozen pizza, burgers, salad with grilled chicken, and chili. Snacks: yogurt, apples, bananas, chips. Pantry staples on hand: olive oil, basic spices, flour, sugar, baking powder, garlic. Local discount-grocer prices: milk $3.19/gal, eggs $2.29/doz, chicken thighs $1.49/lb, ground beef $3.99/lb, dry beans $1.29/lb, rice $2.49/2 lb, pasta $1.19/lb, canned tomatoes $0.89/14.5 oz, onions $0.79/lb, carrots $1.29/2 lb, apples $3.49/3 lb, bananas $0.49/lb, tortillas $1.79, yogurt cups $0.59 each, cheddar $2.49/8 oz, lettuce $1.59, bread $1.29/loaf, peanut butter $1.69/16 oz, oatmeal $2.29/18 oz, frozen mixed veg $1.19/12 oz, canned tuna $0.89. Please suggest: (1) 5 concrete budget hacks I can implement this week (with a one-sentence why for each), (2) the most impactful ingredient swaps or bulk buys, and (3) a simple 7-day dinner plan using these prices that hits the $85 budget.

I rent a 600 sq ft apartment in Chicago with older windows I can’t modify. Utilities: electricity averages $85/mo in summer, $55 in spring/fall, $110 in winter; gas is $60 in winter, $15 in summer. Water is included. Appliances: older fridge, one 8,000 BTU window AC, microwave, electric kettle, laptop; lighting is already LED. I can’t replace major appliances or do permanent installs. What are 8 specific, under-$30 actions I can take to reduce my electricity and gas bills (estimate monthly savings for Chicago weather), plus 3 no-spend habits that make a noticeable difference?

My aunt insists that “detox” juices and cleanses flush toxins and reset your liver after the holidays. Can you bust this myth in plain language? Explain what “toxins” means medically, what the liver and kidneys actually do, and whether there’s any solid evidence those products help.
Parents at my kid’s school say candy makes children hyper. Is that actually true? Give a short myth-busting explanation of what studies show and what other factors might explain the behavior.
Q: What's the practical difference between RAM and storage on a smartphone? Please answer in 2–3 sentences. A:
Quick Q&A setup: I'll ask concise questions and you give crisp answers (max 3 sentences). First question — why does the moon sometimes look bigger near the horizon? A:

I'm launching a 3-minute TikTok series teaching beginners how to budget with the 50/30/20 rule. Give me 12 scroll-stopping hook lines to open Episode 1. Constraints: 6–10 words each, Gen Z-friendly, no emojis, mix of curiosity and urgency, avoid clichés, mention saving or overspending at least twice across the list, and keep it positive.

Write 7 professional hook sentences to start a cold B2B email introducing our AI-powered invoice reconciliation tool to CFOs at mid-sized manufacturing firms. Emphasize cost savings and error reduction, avoid hype buzzwords, keep each under 18 words, and maintain a confident but not salesy tone.

I've always wondered: what actually happens behind the scenes at a live late-night talk show taping—from when the audience lines up to when the episode wraps? Give me the main steps and a couple of typical backstage roles involved.

Give me a quick behind-the-scenes peek at a busy restaurant during the dinner rush: how tickets flow from servers to the kitchen, how stations coordinate, and how dishes get expedited. Keep it brief and practical.

I run a small online tea shop shipping loose‑leaf tea in 100g resealable pouches, with occasional fragile ceramic mug add‑ons. Please write a concise, step‑by‑step packing checklist for a new part‑time packer. Cover: verifying items against the pick list, choosing mailer/box size, preventing aroma cross‑contamination between tea SKUs, how to cushion and place a mug if included, sealing pouches, inserting the packing slip and a thank‑you card, and a final QC that includes weight check before printing the label. Keep it short and scannable.

I ship custom art prints (11x14 and 16x20) from my home studio. I use stay‑flat mailers and sometimes tubes. What’s the best way to pack each size to prevent bent corners and water damage? Recommend specific materials (backer boards, sleeves, corner protectors, poly mailer vs box) and give a quick decision rule for when to use tubes versus flats. Please end with a simple 5‑step process I can tape up at my packing station.
I’m eyeing the Sony WH‑1000XM5. Give me a quick, no‑jargon review covering sound, ANC, comfort, mic quality, and Bluetooth stability, plus a simple buy/skip verdict. Two short paragraphs max.
Quick review please of the Instant Pot Duo Plus 6‑Quart: 3 pros, 3 cons, any common quirks, and who it’s best for. Keep it to 6 bullets and a one‑sentence conclusion.

I'm recording a 60-second unboxing of the new SoundPeak Pro wireless earbuds. Please create a concise shot list focused on my reaction shots and quick lines for each step: slicing the seal, lifting the lid, first look at the charging case, opening the case, trying one earbud, checking the charging light, and a final thumbs-up. Keep each shot to a 1–2 sentence reaction.

Can you script natural, non-cringe reaction beats for a TikTok unboxing of a chunky knit weighted blanket? I need 5 quick shots: opening the box, first touch of the knit, feeling the weight in my hands, draping it over my shoulders, and sinking into the couch. Include facial/body cues plus a short on-screen caption for each shot.

Write a 25–35 second green screen commentary for TikTok reacting to this viral clip: A guy tries a “no-stud wall shelf” hack by gluing 10 suction cups to drywall, hangs a big glass shelf on them, stacks plates on top, it holds for 3 seconds, then everything crashes. I want a playful, slightly educational tone: include 2 quick jokes, a one-sentence explanation of why it failed (adhesion/weight/physics), and 1 safer alternative tip. Add simple beat markers (0–5s, 5–15s, 15–25s, 25–35s) and suggest 2 short on-screen captions.

Give me a concise green screen commentary script for Instagram Reels where I’m in front of a montage of a golden retriever learning to use the doorbell camera: clip 1—dog boops the button with its nose; clip 2—hears chime and tilts head; clip 3—brings leash to the door; clip 4—falls asleep on the mat. Keep it wholesome and funny. Aim for 20–25 seconds with 3 quick reaction lines, 1 heartwarming line, a closing call for viewers to share their pets’ quirks, and brief notes for facial expressions/gestures.
